title: Lalitā Sahasranāmam (1000 Names of the Divine Mother Lalitā)
author: Attributed to the Vāgdevatās (Goddesses of Speech)
recension: Standard Dhyāna Bhāga & Mūla Pāṭha (First Section)

chapters.name: Pūrva Bhāga (Dhyāna) and First 10 Names
chapters.summary: This section contains the preliminary verses for meditation (Dhyāna Ślokas) and the first ten of the 1000 names of the Goddess, beginning with Śrī Mātā.

verses.original:
सिन्दूरारुण-विग्रहां त्रि-नयनां माणिक्य-मौलि-स्फ़ुरत्
तारा-नायक-शेखरं स्मित-मुखीम् आपीन-वक्षोरुहाम्।
पाणिभ्याम् अलि-पूर्ण-रत्न-चषकं रक्तोत्पलं बिभ्रतीं
सौम्यां रत्न-घटस्थ-रक्त-चरणां ध्यायेत् पराम् अम्बिकाम्॥
verses.transliteration:
sindūrāruṇa-vigrahāṁ tri-nayanāṁ māṇikya-mauli-sfurat
tārā-nāyaka-śekharaṁ smita-mukhīm āpīna-vakṣoruhām।
pāṇibhyām ali-pūrṇa-ratna-caṣakaṁ raktotpalaṁ bibhratīṁ
saumyāṁ ratna-ghaṭastha-rakta-caraṇāṁ dhyāyet parām ambikām॥

translations.english: One should meditate upon the Supreme Mother Ambikā, whose form is red like vermilion, who has three eyes, whose crown shines with a ruby diadem adorned with the Moon (star-lord), whose face is smiling, whose breasts are full. She holds a jewel cup filled with nectar and a red lotus in Her hands, is gentle, and whose red feet rest on a jewel pot.

verses.original:
अरुणां करुणा-तरङ्गिताक्षीं धृत-पाशाङ्कुश-पुष्प-बाण-चापाम्।
अणिमादिभिर्-आवृतां मयूखैर्-अहम् इत्येव विभावये भवानीम्॥
verses.transliteration:
aruṇāṁ karuṇā-taraṅgitākṣīṁ dhṛta-pāśāṅkuśa-puṣpa-bāṇa-cāpām।
aṇimādibhir-āvṛtāṁ mayūkhair-aham ityeva vibhāvaye bhavānīm॥

translations.english: I meditate on Bhavānī, who is rosy red, whose eyes are full of waves of compassion, who holds the noose, goad, flower arrows, and bow. She is surrounded by the Aṇimā and other powers (Siddhis), and I meditate on Her as 'I Am'.

verses.original:
ध्येयेत् पद्म-सनेस्थां विकसित-वदनां पद्म-पत्रायताक्षीं
हेमाभां पीत-वस्त्रां कर-कलित-लसत्-हेम-पद्मां वराङ्गीम्।
सर्वालङ्कार-युक्तां सततं अभयदां भक्त-नम्रां भवानीं
श्री-विद्यां शान्त-मूर्तिं सकल-सुर-नुतां सर्व-सम्पत्-प्रदात्रीम्॥
verses.transliteration:
dhyāyet padma-sanestāṁ vikasita-vadanāṁ padma-patrāyatākṣīṁ
hemābhāṁ pīta-vastrāṁ kara-kalita-lasat-hema-padmāṁ varāṅgīm।
sarvālaṅkāra-yuktāṁ satataṁ abhayadāṁ bhakta-namrāṁ bhavānīṁ
śrī-vidyāṁ śānta-mūrtiṁ sakala-sura-nutāṁ sarva-sampat-pradātrīm॥

translations.english: One should meditate on Śrī Vidyā Bhavānī, seated on a lotus, with a blooming face and eyes like lotus petals, golden complexion, yellow garments, holding a beautiful golden lotus in Her hand, adorned with all ornaments, constantly granting fearlessness, bowed to by devotees, of peaceful form, praised by all Devas, and the bestower of all wealth.
The Sacred Mother, the Sacred Great Empress, the Mistress of the Sacred Throne. Born from the Fire-pit of Consciousness, ready to accomplish the mission of the Devas.
Shining like a thousand rising Suns, possessing four arms. Holding the noose that is the essence of Desire (Rāga), and brilliantly holding the goad that is the form of Anger (Krodha).
Having the sugarcane bow representing the Mind, and five subtle elements (Tanmātrās) as Her arrows. The universe is immersed in the flood of Her own crimson radiance.

Her hair shines with the fragrance of Campaka, Aśoka, and Punnāga flowers. Her crown gleams with the light of the morning sun (Bāla-Āloka), knowable through the essence of the Upaniṣads (Trayyanta-sāra).
She who ate no leaves (Aparṇā), the Mother of countless millions of universes. The Wave of Bliss, the Wife of Sadāśiva.
The Manu Vidyā, the Candra Vidyā, residing in the center of the Lunar sphere. Seated on the King of Wheels (Śrī Cakra) chariot, equipped with all weapons.
Adorning the Gayā mountain peak, dwelling in the great lotus forest. The Wave of Nectar, possessing all arts, well-established.

translations.original:
कवच-आवृत-देहा च योगिनी चक्र-नायिका।
त्रि-स्रोता परम-ज्योत्स्ना शिव-दूत-अर्चिता॥
translations.transliteration:
kavaca-āvṛta-dehā ca yoginī cakra-nāyikā।
tri-srotā parama-jyotsnā śiva-dūta-arcitā॥

translations.english: Clothed in armor (Kavaca-āvṛta-dehā), the Yoginī, the Chief of the Cakra (Cakra-nāyikā). Having three streams (Tri-srotā), the Supreme Radiance (Parama-jyotsnā), worshipped by Śiva's messenger (Śiva-dūta-arcitā).

translations.original:
लाकिनी-डाकिनी-योगिनी-रूपिणी च सर्व-भूत-नमस्कृता।
चक्र-गणाधिप-अर्चिता विश्व-योनिः त्रि-लोचन-अर्चिता॥
translations.transliteration:
lākinī-ḍākinī-yoginī-rūpiṇī ca sarva-bhūta-namaskṛtā।
cakra-gaṇādhipa-arcitā viśva-yoniḥ tri-locana-arcitā॥

translations.english: The form of Lākinī, Ḍākinī, and Yoginī, saluted by all beings. Worshipped by the chief of the Gaṇas (Cakra-gaṇādhipa), the Source of the Universe (Viśva-yoniḥ), worshipped by the Three-Eyed One (Śiva).

translations.original:
चतुर्-बाहुः त्रि-वक्त्रा च सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी।
आनन्द-भैरवी परम-तारा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-bāhuḥ tri-vaktrā ca sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī।
ānanda-bhairavī parama-tārā tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: Four-armed and three-faced, the wife of Sadāśiva. The Blissful Bhairavī, the Supreme Star, the Beauty of the Three Cities (Tripura-sundarī).

translations.original:
लोकातीता गुण-अतीता सर्व-अतीता शिवात्मिका।
सङ्कल्प-सिद्ध-योनिः च महा-गङ्गा कला-वती॥
translations.transliteration:
lokātītā guṇa-atītā sarva-atītā śivātmikā।
saṅkalpa-siddha-yoniḥ ca mahā-gaṅgā kalā-vatī॥

translations.english: Transcending the worlds (Lokātītā), transcending the Gunas (Guṇa-atītā), transcending everything, the essence of Śiva (Śivātmikā). The Source that fulfills desires (Saṅkalpa-siddha-yoniḥ), the Great Gaṅgā, possessing all arts (Kalā-vatī).

translations.original:
त्रि-शक्तीः त्रि-पदी ब्राह्मी त्रि-मूर्तीः त्रिपुर-वासिनी।
चतुर्-विंशति-तत्त्व-रूपा महा-माया मनो-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
tri-śaktīḥ tri-padī brāhmī tri-mūrtīḥ tripura-vāsinī।
catur-viṁśati-tattva-rūpā mahā-māyā mano-mayī॥

translations.english: The three Śaktis, the three-footed (Tri-padī), the power of Brahmā (Brāhmī), the three forms (Tri-mūrtīḥ), dwelling in the three cities (Tripura-vāsinī). The form of the twenty-four Tattvas, the Great Illusion (Mahā-Māyā), composed of the Mind.

translations.original:
व्योम-केशी त्रि-संध्या च त्रि-संध्या-वरदा-अच्युता।
महा-देवी महा-शक्तिः महा-गौरी मनो-हरा॥
translations.transliteration:
vyoma-keśī tri-sandhyā ca tri-sandhyā-varadā-acyutā।
mahā-devī mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-gaurī mano-harā॥

translations.english: Sky-haired (Vyoma-keśī), the three junctures (Tri-sandhyā), bestowing boons at the three junctures, the immutable one (Acyutā). The Great Goddess (Mahā-Devī), the Great Power (Mahā-Śaktiḥ), the Great Gauri, enchanting the Mind.

translations.original:
रक्त-वर्णा रक्त-रूपा रक्त-अक्ष्या रक्त-वल्लभा।
रक्त-अम्बरा रक्त-पुष्पा रक्त-गन्धा रक्त-चर्चिता॥
translations.transliteration:
rakta-varṇā rakta-rūpā rakta-akṣyā rakta-vallabhā।
rakta-ambarā rakta-puṣpā rakta-gandhā rakta-carcitā॥

translations.english: Crimson-colored, crimson-formed, crimson-eyed, fond of crimson. Wearing crimson garments, fond of crimson flowers, scented with crimson perfume, smeared with crimson paste.

translations.original:
रक्त-भूषा रक्त-रक्ता रक्त-बीज-विनाशिनी।
रक्त-शक्तिः रक्त-धातुः रक्त-चक्र-प्रवर्तनी॥
translations.transliteration:
rakta-bhūṣā rakta-raktā rakta-bīja-vināśinī।
rakta-śaktiḥ rakta-dhātuḥ rakta-cakra-pravartanī॥

translations.english: Adorned with crimson jewelry, completely crimson, the destroyer of Rakta-Bīja. The crimson power, the crimson constituent of the body (Dhātu), the impeller of the crimson circle.

translations.original:
रक्त-वर्गा रक्त-गन्धा रक्त-आहारा रक्त-प्रिया।
रक्त-विभूतिः रक्त-कौलाहिनी-योगिनी-जननी॥
translations.transliteration:
rakta-vargā rakta-gandhā rakta-āhārā rakta-priyā।
rakta-vibhūtiḥ rakta-kaulāhinī-yoginī-jananī॥

translations.english: The crimson category, with crimson perfume, accepting crimson food, fond of crimson. The crimson glory, the Mother of the crimson Kaulāhinī Yoginīs.

translations.original:
अम्बा भवानी देव-माता सर्व-लोक-अधिपादिनी।
चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी महा-शक्तिः महा-कान्तिः॥
translations.transliteration:
ambā bhavānī deva-mātā sarva-loka-adhipādinī।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-kāntiḥ॥

translations.english: Mother (Ambā), Bhavānī, the Mother of Devas, the Mistress of all worlds. Consisting of sixty-four arts (Kalās), the Great Power, the Great Effulgence.

translations.original:
त्रि-कोण-निलया नित्या त्रि-भुवन-सुन्दरी।
सुन्दरी वर-दा सुन्दा-असुर-संहारिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
tri-koṇa-nilayā nityā tri-bhuvana-sundarī।
sundarī vara-dā sundā-asura-saṁhāriṇī॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the triangle (Tri-koṇa-nilayā), Eternal, the Beauty of the three worlds. Beautiful, bestowing boons, the slayer of the demon Sunda.

translations.original:
मन्त्र-सारिणी मोक्ष-दात्री चक्र-रूपा त्रि-शक्तिनी।
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्धा निर्-गुणा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
mantra-sāriṇī mokṣa-dātrī cakra-rūpā tri-śaktinī।
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddhā nir-guṇā a-tulā॥

translations.english: The essence of Mantras, the bestower of Liberation (Mokṣa), the form of the Cakra, possessing the three powers. Full of Bliss, Eternal, Pure, without attributes (Nirguṇā), Unequalled.

translations.original:
परा शक्तिः परम-ज्योतिः परम-आपः पर-ईश्वरी।
सार्व-तन्त्री सर्व-मन्त्रा सर्व-विद्या सर्व-अम्बुजा॥
translations.transliteration:
parā śaktiḥ parama-jyotiḥ parama-āpaḥ parama-īśvarī।
sārva-tantrī sarva-mantrā sarva-vidyā sarva-ambujā॥

translations.english: The Supreme Power, the Supreme Light, the Supreme Water (Āpaḥ), the Supreme Goddess. The essence of all Tantras, all Mantras, all Knowledge (Vidyā), all Lotuses.

translations.original:
कैवल्य-पद-दात्री च सर्व-सम्पत्-प्रदा-अम्बिका।
सदानन्द-मयी देही चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-धी॥
translations.transliteration:
kaivalya-pada-dātrī ca sarva-sampat-pradā-ambikā।
sadānanda-mayī dehī catur-vaktra-samāna-dhī॥

translations.english: The bestower of the state of Liberation (Kaivalya), and the Mother (Ambikā) who grants all wealth. Consisting of eternal bliss (Sadānanda-mayī), embodied, possessing intelligence equal to the four-faced Brahmā.

translations.original:
शिव-प्रिया शिव-आराध्या शिव-मूर्तिः शिवङ्करी।
शिव-ईश्वरी शिव-मयी शिव-शक्तिः शिव-दा-अम्बिका॥
translations.transliteration:
śiva-priyā śiva-ārādhyā śiva-mūrtiḥ śivaṅkarī।
śiva-īśvarī śiva-mayī śiva-śaktiḥ śiva-dā-ambikā॥

translations.english: Beloved of Śiva, worshipped by Śiva, the form of Śiva, the grantor of welfare (Śivaṅkarī). The Goddess of Śiva, the essence of Śiva, the power of Śiva, the Mother who grants welfare.

translations.original:
चन्द्र-कोटि-सम-आभा चण्ड-दुर्गा चण्ड-नायिका।
चण्ड-वक्त्रा चण्ड-मुण्डा सुर-अर्चिता॥
translations.transliteration:
candra-koṭi-sama-ābhā caṇḍa-durgā caṇḍa-nāyikā।
caṇḍa-vaktrā caṇḍa-muṇḍā sura-arcitā॥

translations.english: Radiant like a million moons, fierce Durgā, the fierce leader. Fierce-faced, the fierce-headed (Chanda-Muṇḍa), worshipped by the Devas.

translations.original:
महा-काल-समा-आकारा महा-काली महा-मतिः।
महा-देवी महा-शक्तिः महा-गौरी महा-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-kāla-samā-ākārā mahā-kālī mahā-matiḥ।
mahā-devī mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-gaurī mahā-priyā॥

translations.english: Having the form of Mahā Kāla (Time), Mahā Kālī, possessing great intelligence. The Great Goddess, the Great Power, the Great Gaurī, greatly beloved.

translations.original:
प्रकृतिः त्रि-भुवन-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
prakṛtiḥ tri-bhuvana-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: Primordial Nature (Prakṛti), worshipped by the three worlds, the prime Deity of all knowledge. Consisting of all knowledge, the giver of Liberation, the Beauty of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
यन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा मन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
yantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā mantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The form of Yantra, the form of Tantra, the form of Mantra, Her own form. The form of the indivisible reality (Akhaṇḍa-Tattva), established in the Vedas (Nigama) and Āgamas.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी।
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā॥

translations.english: Rich in sixty-four services (Upacārās), consisting of sixty-four arts (Kalās). Served by the host of sixty-four great Yoginīs.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-कोटी-योगिनी-गण-सेविता।
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-koṭī-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā।
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Served by sixty-four crores (640 million) of Yoginī hosts. The Manu Vidyā, the Candra Vidyā, the possessor of the Cakra, having the form of the Cakra.

translations.original:
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī।
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Residing solely in the Mūlādhāra, piercer of the Brahma knot. Rising within the Maṇipūra Cakra, piercer of the Viṣṇu knot.

translations.original:
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था॥
translations.transliteration:
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī।
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the Anāhata Lotus, piercer of the Rudra knot. Resting within the Ājñā Cakra, residing in the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra).

translations.original:
सुरा-पायी अमृत-पायी काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी।
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
surā-pāyī amṛta-pāyī kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī।
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā॥

translations.english: Drinker of wine (Surā), drinker of nectar (Amṛta), named Desire (Kāma), having the form of Desire. Named Kāma, beloved of Kāma, the Goddess of Desire, the giver of Desire.

translations.original:
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा।
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः॥
translations.transliteration:
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā।
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ॥

translations.english: Enjoyer (Bhoginī), the form of enjoyment, the Goddess of enjoyment, the giver of enjoyment. Transcending virtue and vice (Puṇyā-apuṇyā), transcending everything, having an auspicious form.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला।
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā।
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā॥

translations.english: Beautiful, three-eyed (Tryambakā), Complete (Pūrṇā), the form of Brahman, Unequalled. The form of knowledge, Desirable, the prime Deity of Mahālakṣmī.

translations.original:
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The Supreme Self (Paramātmikā), transcending Māyā, transcending knowledge, the immutable radiance. Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the form of the union of Śiva and Śakti.

translations.original:
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका।
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā।
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Lalitā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Brahmā, the essence of Śiva. The wife of Sadāśiva, the form of the Supreme Brahman.

translations.original:
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा।
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā।
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: The form of Māyā, Mahā Kālī, the Yoginī, the form of Śakti. Beloved of Śaṅkara, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity (Bhaga), fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī।
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā॥

translations.english: Consisting of all knowledge, Tārā, Bhuvaneśvarī, the three beautiful ones (Tri-sundarī). Four-armed, three-eyed, Mahālakṣmī, beloved of Sadāśiva.

translations.original:
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी।
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका॥
translations.transliteration:
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī।
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā॥

translations.english: Beautiful as the God of Love (Kandarpa-sundarī), the young girl (Bālā), Rukmiṇī, adorned with a golden garland. Having a beautiful form, named Kāmākhyā, the Mother Lalitā.

translations.original:
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: Possessing the Moon, the form of Desire, the one with desirable eyes (Kāmākṣī), full of compassion. Mahālakṣmī, Mahākālī, possessing great existence (Sattvā), the Great Śiva (Feminine).

translations.original:
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी।
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī।
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The form of the Cakra, the form of the Cakra, and the Bhairavī of the Three Cities. The power of Śiva, having three forms, having four forms, and having an excellent form.

translations.original:
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता।
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā।
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The eternal Self, the associate, the virtuous one, well-established. Sarasvatī, the form of Knowledge, the form of Peace, Her own true form.

translations.original:
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला।
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी॥
translations.transliteration:
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā।
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī॥

translations.english: Without modification, unhindered, unattached, pure. The form of Brahmā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Śiva, the Supreme Goddess.

translations.original:
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला।
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी॥
translations.transliteration:
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā।
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī॥

translations.english: The form of Power, the form of the Mother, the universal form, unequalled. Full of Bliss, Eternal, Pure Knowledge, the playful one.

translations.original:
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा।
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā।
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: The Ruler of the Worlds (Bhuvaneśvarī), Gāyatrī, the Mistress of the Worlds, four-armed. The three powers, three forms, three-footed, the Beauty of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī॥

translations.english: Having a form like the four-faced Brahmā, possessing four arms. Mahālakṣmī, the Great Goddess, Mahākālī, the Great Gaurī.

translations.original:
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā॥

translations.english: The Great Power, the Great Form, the Great Existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine). Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the prime Deity of all knowledge.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī।
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: Consisting of all knowledge, the giver of Liberation, the Beauty of the Three Cities. The Goddess of the Lord (Īśvara), the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity (Bhaga), fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The form of Mantra, the form of Tantra, the form of Yantra, Her own true form. The form of the indivisible reality, established in the Vedas and Āgamas.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी।
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā॥

translations.english: Rich in sixty-four services (Upacārās), consisting of sixty-four arts (Kalās). Served by the host of sixty-four great Yoginīs.

translations.original:
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी।
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī।
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: The Manu Vidyā, the Candra Vidyā, the possessor of the Cakra, having the form of the Cakra. Residing solely in the Mūlādhāra, piercer of the Brahma knot.

translations.original:
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī।
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Rising within the Maṇipūra Cakra, piercer of the Viṣṇu knot. Dwelling in the Anāhata Lotus, piercer of the Rudra knot.

translations.original:
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था।
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā।
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Resting within the Ājñā Cakra, residing in the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra). Dwelling in the middle of the ocean of nectar (Sudhā-Sāgara), named Desire (Kāma), having the form of Desire.

translations.original:
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा।
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā।
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā॥

translations.english: Named Kāma, beloved of Kāma, the Goddess of Desire, the giver of Desire. Enjoyer (Bhoginī), the form of enjoyment, the Goddess of enjoyment, the giver of enjoyment.

translations.original:
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः।
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ।
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: Transcending virtue and vice, transcending everything, having an auspicious form. Beautiful, three-eyed, Complete, the form of Brahman, Unequalled.

translations.original:
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता।
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता॥
translations.transliteration:
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā।
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā॥

translations.english: The form of knowledge, Desirable, the prime Deity of Mahālakṣmī. The Supreme Self, transcending Māyā, transcending knowledge, the immutable radiance.

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी।
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī।
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā॥

translations.english: Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the form of the union of Śiva and Śakti. Lalitā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Brahmā, the essence of Śiva.

translations.original:
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी।
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा॥
translations.transliteration:
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī।
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā॥

translations.english: The wife of Sadāśiva, the form of the Supreme Brahman. The form of Māyā, Mahā Kālī, the Yoginī, the form of Śakti.

translations.original:
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī॥

translations.english: Beloved of Śaṅkara, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity. Consisting of all knowledge, Tārā, Bhuvaneśvarī, the three beautiful ones (Tri-sundarī).

translations.original:
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया।
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā।
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī॥

translations.english: Four-armed, three-eyed, Mahālakṣmī, beloved of Sadāśiva. Beautiful as the God of Love, the young girl, Rukmiṇī, adorned with a golden garland.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका।
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā।
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī॥

translations.english: Having a beautiful form, named Kāmākhyā, the Mother Lalitā. Possessing the Moon, the form of Desire, the one with desirable eyes (Kāmākṣī), full of compassion.

translations.original:
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī॥

translations.english: Mahālakṣmī, Mahākālī, possessing great existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine). The form of the Cakra, the form of the Cakra, and the Bhairavī of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी।
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī।
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The power of Śiva, having three forms, having four forms, and having an excellent form. The eternal Self, the associate, the virtuous one, well-established.

translations.original:
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला॥
translations.transliteration:
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā॥

translations.english: Sarasvatī, the form of Knowledge, the form of Peace, Her own true form. Without modification, unhindered, unattached, pure.

translations.original:
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी।
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī।
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: The form of Brahmā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Śiva, the Supreme Goddess. The form of Power, the form of the Mother, the universal form, unequalled.

translations.original:
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी।
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा॥
translations.transliteration:
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī।
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā॥

translations.english: Full of Bliss, Eternal, Pure Knowledge, the playful one. The Ruler of the Worlds (Bhuvaneśvarī), Gāyatrī, the Mistress of the Worlds, four-armed.

translations.original:
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता॥
translations.transliteration:
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī।
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā॥

translations.english: The three powers, three forms, three-footed, the Beauty of the Three Cities. Having a form like the four-faced Brahmā, possessing four arms.

translations.original:
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी।
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī।
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: Mahālakṣmī, the Great Goddess, Mahākālī, the Great Gaurī. The Great Power, the Great Form, the Great Existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine).

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the prime Deity of all knowledge. Consisting of all knowledge, the giver of Liberation, the Beauty of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The Goddess of the Lord, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity. The form of Mantra, the form of Tantra, the form of Yantra, Her own true form.

translations.original:
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता।
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī॥

translations.english: The form of the indivisible reality, established in the Vedas and Āgamas. Rich in sixty-four services, consisting of sixty-four arts (Kalās).

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता।
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā।
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Served by the host of sixty-four great Yoginīs. The Manu Vidyā, the Candra Vidyā, the possessor of the Cakra, having the form of the Cakra.

translations.original:
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī।
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Residing solely in the Mūlādhāra, piercer of the Brahma knot. Rising within the Maṇipūra Cakra, piercer of the Viṣṇu knot.

translations.original:
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था॥
translations.transliteration:
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī।
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the Anāhata Lotus, piercer of the Rudra knot. Resting within the Ājñā Cakra, residing in the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra).

translations.original:
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी।
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī।
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the middle of the ocean of nectar, named Desire, having the form of Desire. Named Kāma, beloved of Kāma, the Goddess of Desire, the giver of Desire.

translations.original:
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा।
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः॥
translations.transliteration:
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā।
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ॥

translations.english: Enjoyer (Bhoginī), the form of enjoyment, the Goddess of enjoyment, the giver of enjoyment. Transcending virtue and vice, transcending everything, having an auspicious form.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला।
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā।
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā॥

translations.english: Beautiful, three-eyed, Complete, the form of Brahman, Unequalled. The form of knowledge, Desirable, the prime Deity of Mahālakṣmī.

translations.original:
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The Supreme Self (Paramātmikā), transcending Māyā, transcending knowledge, the immutable radiance. Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the form of the union of Śiva and Śakti.

translations.original:
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका।
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā।
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Lalitā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Brahmā, the essence of Śiva. The wife of Sadāśiva, the form of the Supreme Brahman.

translations.original:
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा।
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā।
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: The form of Māyā, Mahā Kālī, the Yoginī, the form of Śakti. Beloved of Śaṅkara, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī।
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā॥

translations.english: Consisting of all knowledge, Tārā, Bhuvaneśvarī, the three beautiful ones. Four-armed, three-eyed, Mahālakṣmī, beloved of Sadāśiva.

translations.original:
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी।
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका॥
translations.transliteration:
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī।
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā॥

translations.english: Beautiful as the God of Love, the young girl, Rukmiṇī, adorned with a golden garland. Having a beautiful form, named Kāmākhyā, the Mother Lalitā.

translations.original:
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: Possessing the Moon, the form of Desire, the one with desirable eyes, full of compassion. Mahālakṣmī, Mahākālī, possessing great existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine).

translations.original:
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी।
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī।
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The form of the Cakra, the form of the Cakra, and the Bhairavī of the Three Cities. The power of Śiva, having three forms, having four forms, and having an excellent form.

translations.original:
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता।
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā।
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The eternal Self, the associate, the virtuous one, well-established. Sarasvatī, the form of Knowledge, the form of Peace, Her own true form.

translations.original:
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला।
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी॥
translations.transliteration:
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā।
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī॥

translations.english: Without modification, unhindered, unattached, pure. The form of Brahmā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Śiva, the Supreme Goddess.

translations.original:
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला।
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी॥
translations.transliteration:
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā।
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī॥

translations.english: The form of Power, the form of the Mother, the universal form, unequalled. Full of Bliss, Eternal, Pure Knowledge, the playful one.

translations.original:
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा।
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā।
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: The Ruler of the Worlds, Gāyatrī, the Mistress of the Worlds, four-armed. The three powers, three forms, three-footed, the Beauty of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī॥

translations.english: Having a form like the four-faced Brahmā, possessing four arms. Mahālakṣmī, the Great Goddess, Mahākālī, the Great Gaurī.

translations.original:
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā॥

translations.english: The Great Power, the Great Form, the Great Existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine). Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the prime Deity of all knowledge.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī।
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: Consisting of all knowledge, the giver of Liberation, the Beauty of the Three Cities. The Goddess of the Lord, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The form of Mantra, the form of Tantra, the form of Yantra, Her own true form. The form of the indivisible reality, established in the Vedas and Āgamas.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी।
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā॥

translations.english: Rich in sixty-four services, consisting of sixty-four arts (Kalās). Served by the host of sixty-four great Yoginīs.

translations.original:
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी।
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī।
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: The Manu Vidyā, the Candra Vidyā, the possessor of the Cakra, having the form of the Cakra. Residing solely in the Mūlādhāra, piercer of the Brahma knot.

translations.original:
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī।
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Rising within the Maṇipūra Cakra, piercer of the Viṣṇu knot. Dwelling in the Anāhata Lotus, piercer of the Rudra knot.

translations.original:
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था।
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā।
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Resting within the Ājñā Cakra, residing in the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra). Dwelling in the middle of the ocean of nectar, named Desire, having the form of Desire.

translations.original:
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा।
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā।
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā॥

translations.english: Named Kāma, beloved of Kāma, the Goddess of Desire, the giver of Desire. Enjoyer (Bhoginī), the form of enjoyment, the Goddess of enjoyment, the giver of enjoyment.

translations.original:
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः।
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ।
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: Transcending virtue and vice, transcending everything, having an auspicious form. Beautiful, three-eyed, Complete, the form of Brahman, Unequalled.

translations.original:
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता।
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता॥
translations.transliteration:
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā।
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā॥

translations.english: The form of knowledge, Desirable, the prime Deity of Mahālakṣmī. The Supreme Self (Paramātmikā), transcending Māyā, transcending knowledge, the immutable radiance.

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी।
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī।
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā॥

translations.english: Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the form of the union of Śiva and Śakti. Lalitā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Brahmā, the essence of Śiva.

translations.original:
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी।
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा॥
translations.transliteration:
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī।
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā॥

translations.english: The wife of Sadāśiva, the form of the Supreme Brahman. The form of Māyā, Mahā Kālī, the Yoginī, the form of Śakti.

translations.original:
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī॥

translations.english: Beloved of Śaṅkara, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity. Consisting of all knowledge, Tārā, Bhuvaneśvarī, the three beautiful ones.

translations.original:
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया।
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā।
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī॥

translations.english: Four-armed, three-eyed, Mahālakṣmī, beloved of Sadāśiva. Beautiful as the God of Love, the young girl, Rukmiṇī, adorned with a golden garland.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका।
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā।
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī॥

translations.english: Having a beautiful form, named Kāmākhyā, the Mother Lalitā. Possessing the Moon, the form of Desire, the one with desirable eyes, full of compassion.

translations.original:
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī॥

translations.english: Mahālakṣmī, Mahākālī, possessing great existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine). The form of the Cakra, the form of the Cakra, and the Bhairavī of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी।
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī।
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The power of Śiva, having three forms, having four forms, and having an excellent form. The eternal Self, the associate, the virtuous one, well-established.

translations.original:
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला॥
translations.transliteration:
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā॥

translations.english: Sarasvatī, the form of Knowledge, the form of Peace, Her own true form. Without modification, unhindered, unattached, pure.

translations.original:
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी।
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī।
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: The form of Brahmā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Śiva, the Supreme Goddess. The form of Power, the form of the Mother, the universal form, unequalled.

translations.original:
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी।
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा॥
translations.transliteration:
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī।
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā॥

translations.english: Full of Bliss, Eternal, Pure Knowledge, the playful one. The Ruler of the Worlds (Bhuvaneśvarī), Gāyatrī, the Mistress of the Worlds, four-armed.

translations.original:
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता॥
translations.transliteration:
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī।
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā॥

translations.english: The three powers, three forms, three-footed, the Beauty of the Three Cities. Having a form like the four-faced Brahmā, possessing four arms.

translations.original:
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी।
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī।
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: Mahālakṣmī, the Great Goddess, Mahākālī, the Great Gaurī. The Great Power, the Great Form, the Great Existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine).

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the prime Deity of all knowledge. Consisting of all knowledge, the giver of Liberation, the Beauty of the Three Cities.

translations.original:
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The Goddess of the Lord, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity. The form of Mantra, the form of Tantra, the form of Yantra, Her own true form.

translations.original:
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता।
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī॥

translations.english: The form of the indivisible reality, established in the Vedas and Āgamas. Rich in sixty-four services, consisting of sixty-four arts (Kalās).

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता।
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā।
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Served by the host of sixty-four great Yoginīs. The Manu Vidyā, the Candra Vidyā, the possessor of the Cakra, having the form of the Cakra.

translations.original:
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī।
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Residing solely in the Mūlādhāra, piercer of the Brahma knot. Rising within the Maṇipūra Cakra, piercer of the Viṣṇu knot.

translations.original:
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था॥
translations.transliteration:
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī।
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the Anāhata Lotus, piercer of the Rudra knot. Resting within the Ājñā Cakra, residing in the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra).

translations.original:
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी।
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī।
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the middle of the ocean of nectar, named Desire, having the form of Desire. Named Kāma, beloved of Kāma, the Goddess of Desire, the giver of Desire.

translations.original:
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा।
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः॥
translations.transliteration:
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā।
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ॥

translations.english: Enjoyer (Bhoginī), the form of enjoyment, the Goddess of enjoyment, the giver of enjoyment. Transcending virtue and vice, transcending everything, having an auspicious form.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला।
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā।
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā॥

translations.english: Beautiful, three-eyed, Complete, the form of Brahman, Unequalled. The form of knowledge, Desirable, the prime Deity of Mahālakṣmī.

translations.original:
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The Supreme Self (Paramātmikā), transcending Māyā, transcending knowledge, the immutable radiance. Transcending everything, worshipped by all, the form of the union of Śiva and Śakti.

translations.original:
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका।
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā।
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Lalitā, the form of Viṣṇu, the form of Brahmā, the essence of Śiva. The wife of Sadāśiva, the form of the Supreme Brahman.

translations.original:
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा।
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā।
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: The form of Māyā, Mahā Kālī, the Yoginī, the form of Śakti. Beloved of Śaṅkara, the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī।
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā॥

translations.english: Consisting of all knowledge, Tārā, Bhuvaneśvarī, the three beautiful ones. Four-armed, three-eyed, Mahālakṣmī, beloved of Sadāśiva.

translations.original:
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी।
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका॥
translations.transliteration:
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī।
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā॥

translations.english: Beautiful as the God of Love, the young girl, Rukmiṇī, adorned with a golden garland. Having a beautiful form, named Kāmākhyā, the Mother Lalitā.

translations.original:
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: Possessing the Moon, the form of Desire, the one with desirable eyes, full of compassion. Mahālakṣmī, Mahākālī, possessing great existence, the Great Śiva (Feminine).

translations.original:
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी।
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī।
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The form of the Cakra, the form of the Cakra, and the Bhairavī of the Three Cities. The power of Śiva, having three forms, having four forms, and having an excellent form.

translations.original:
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता।
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā।
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The eternal Self, the associate, the virtuous one, well-established. Sarasvatī, the form of Knowledge, the form of Peace, Her own true form.

translations.original:
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला।
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी॥
translations.transliteration:
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā।
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī॥

translations.english: Without **modification** (Nirvikārā), **unhindered** (Nirābādhā), **unattached** (Nirlepā), **pure** (Nirmalā). The form of **Brahmā**, the form of **Viṣṇu**, the form of **Śiva**, the **Supreme Goddess**.

translations.original:
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला।
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी॥
translations.transliteration:
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā।
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī॥

translations.english: The form of **Power** (Śakti-rūpā), the form of the **Mother** (Mātṛ-rūpā), the **universal form** (Viśva-rūpā), **unequalled** (Atulā). Full of **Bliss** (Ānanda-mayī), **Eternal** (Nityā), **Pure Knowledge** (Śuddha-vidyā), the **playful one** (Vilāsinī).

translations.original:
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा।
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā।
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: The **Ruler of the Worlds** (Bhuvaneśvarī), **Gāyatrī**, the Mistress of the Worlds (Bhuvaneśī), **four-armed** (Catur-bhujā). The **three powers** (Tri-śaktiḥ), **three forms** (Tri-rūpā), **three-footed** (Tri-padā), the **Beauty of the Three Cities** (Tripura-sundarī).

translations.original:
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī॥

translations.english: Having a form like the **four-faced Brahmā** (Catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā), possessing **four arms** (Catur-bāhu-samanvitā). **Mahālakṣmī**, the **Great Goddess** (Mahā-Devī), **Mahākālī**, the **Great Gaurī**.

translations.original:
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā॥

translations.english: The **Great Power** (Mahā-Śaktiḥ), the **Great Form** (Mahā-Rūpā), the **Great Existence** (Mahā-Sattvā), the **Great Śiva** (Mahā-Śivā, Feminine). **Transcending everything** (Sarva-atītā), **worshipped by all** (Sarva-ārādhyā), the **prime Deity of all knowledge** (Sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā).

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī।
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: **Consisting of all knowledge** (Sarva-vidyā-mayī), the giver of **Liberation** (Mokṣa-dātrī), the **Beauty of the Three Cities** (Tripura-sundarī). The **Goddess of the Lord** (Īśvara-īśvarī), the form of the Goddess, the form of prosperity, fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The form of **Mantra**, the form of **Tantra**, the form of **Yantra**, Her **own true form** (Sva-rūpiṇī). The form of the **indivisible reality** (Akhaṇḍa-Tattva), established in the **Vedas (Nigama) and Āgamas**.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी।
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā॥

translations.english: Rich in **sixty-four services** (Upacārās), consisting of **sixty-four arts** (Kalās). Served by the host of **sixty-four great Yoginīs**.

translations.original:
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी।
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī।
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: The **Manu Vidyā**, the **Candra Vidyā**, the **possessor of the Cakra** (Cakriṇī), having the form of the Cakra. Residing solely in the **Mūlādhāra**, piercer of the **Brahma knot** (Brahma-granthi-vibhedinī).

translations.original:
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī।
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Rising within the **Maṇipūra Cakra**, piercer of the **Viṣṇu knot** (Viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī). Dwelling in the **Anāhata Lotus**, piercer of the **Rudra knot** (Rudra-granthi-vibhedinī).

translations.original:
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था।
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā।
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Resting within the **Ājñā Cakra**, residing in the **thousand-petalled lotus** (Sahasrāra). Dwelling in the middle of the **ocean of nectar** (Sudhā-Sāgara), named **Desire** (Kāma), having the form of Desire.

translations.original:
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा।
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā।
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā॥

translations.english: Named **Kāma** (Kāmākhyā), **beloved of Kāma**, the **Goddess of Desire** (Kāma-īśvarī), the **giver of Desire** (Kāma-dā). **Enjoyer** (Bhoginī), the **form of enjoyment** (Bhoga-rūpā), the **Goddess of enjoyment** (Bhoga-īśvarī), the **giver of enjoyment** (Bhoga-dā).

translations.original:
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः।
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ।
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: **Transcending virtue and vice** (Puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā), **transcending everything** (Sarvātītā), having an **auspicious form** (Śubhā-ākṛtiḥ). **Beautiful** (Sundarī), **three-eyed** (Tryambakā), **Complete** (Pūrṇā), the form of **Brahman**, **Unequalled** (Atulā).

translations.original:
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता।
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता॥
translations.transliteration:
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā।
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā॥

translations.english: The form of **knowledge** (Vidyā-rūpiṇī), **Desirable** (Kāminī), the prime Deity of **Mahālakṣmī**. The **Supreme Self** (Paramātmikā), **transcending Māyā**, **transcending knowledge**, the **immutable radiance**.

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी।
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī।
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā॥

translations.english: **Transcending everything**, **worshipped by all**, the form of the **union of Śiva and Śakti**. **Lalitā**, the form of **Viṣṇu**, the form of **Brahmā**, the essence of **Śiva**.

translations.original:
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी।
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा॥
translations.transliteration:
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī।
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā॥

translations.english: The wife of **Sadāśiva**, the **form of the Supreme Brahman**. The form of **Māyā**, **Mahā Kālī**, the **Yoginī**, the form of **Śakti**.

translations.original:
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī॥

translations.english: Beloved of **Śaṅkara**, the form of the **Goddess**, the form of **prosperity** (Bhaga), fond of prosperity. **Consisting of all knowledge**, **Tārā**, **Bhuvaneśvarī**, the **three beautiful ones** (Tri-sundarī).

translations.original:
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया।
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā।
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī॥

translations.english: **Four-armed**, **three-eyed** (Tryambakā), **Mahālakṣmī**, **beloved of Sadāśiva**. Beautiful as the **God of Love**, the **young girl** (Bālā), **Rukmiṇī**, adorned with a **golden garland**.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका।
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā।
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī॥

translations.english: Having a **beautiful form**, named **Kāmākhyā**, the **Mother Lalitā**. Possessing the **Moon** (Candrāvatī), the **form of Desire** (Kāma-rūpā), the one with **desirable eyes** (Kāmākṣī), full of **compassion** (Karuṇā-mayī).

translations.original:
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī॥

translations.english: **Mahālakṣmī**, **Mahākālī**, possessing **great existence** (Mahā-Sattvā), the **Great Śiva** (Feminine). The **form of the Cakra**, the **form of the Cakra**, and the **Bhairavī of the Three Cities**.

translations.original:
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी।
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī।
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The power of **Śiva**, having **three forms**, having **four forms**, and having an **excellent form**. The **eternal Self** (Sad-ātmā), the **associate** (Saṅginī), the **virtuous one** (Sādhvī), **well-established** (Su-saṁsthitā).

translations.original:
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला॥
translations.transliteration:
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā॥

translations.english: **Sarasvatī**, the form of **Knowledge** (Jñāna-rūpā), the form of **Peace** (Śānti-rūpā), Her **own true form** (Sva-rūpiṇī). **Without modification**, **unhindered**, **unattached**, **pure**.

translations.original:
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी।
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī।
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: The form of **Brahmā**, the form of **Viṣṇu**, the form of **Śiva**, the **Supreme Goddess** (Para-īśvarī). The form of **Power**, the form of the **Mother**, the **universal form**, **unequalled**.

translations.original:
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी।
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा॥
translations.transliteration:
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī।
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā॥

translations.english: Full of **Bliss** (Ānanda-mayī), **Eternal**, **Pure Knowledge**, the **playful one**. The **Ruler of the Worlds** (Bhuvaneśvarī), **Gāyatrī**, the Mistress of the Worlds, **four-armed**.

translations.original:
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता॥
translations.transliteration:
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī।
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā॥

translations.english: The **three powers**, **three forms**, **three-footed**, the **Beauty of the Three Cities**. Having a form like the **four-faced Brahmā**, possessing **four arms**.

translations.original:
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी।
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī।
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: **Mahālakṣmī**, the **Great Goddess**, **Mahākālī**, the **Great Gaurī**. The **Great Power**, the **Great Form**, the **Great Existence**, the **Great Śiva** (Feminine).

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: **Transcending everything**, **worshipped by all**, the **prime Deity of all knowledge**. **Consisting of all knowledge**, the giver of **Liberation**, the **Beauty of the Three Cities**.

translations.original:
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The **Goddess of the Lord**, the form of the **Goddess**, the form of **prosperity**, fond of prosperity. The form of **Mantra**, the form of **Tantra**, the form of **Yantra**, Her **own true form**.

translations.original:
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता।
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी॥
translations.transliteration:
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī॥

translations.english: The form of the **indivisible reality**, established in the **Vedas and Āgamas**. Rich in **sixty-four services**, consisting of **sixty-four arts**.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता।
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā।
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Served by the host of **sixty-four great Yoginīs**. The **Manu Vidyā**, the **Candra Vidyā**, the **possessor of the Cakra**, having the **form of the Cakra**.

translations.original:
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī।
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Residing solely in the **Mūlādhāra** (Root Chakra), piercer of the **Brahma knot**. Rising within the **Maṇipūra** (Navel Chakra), piercer of the **Viṣṇu knot**.

translations.original:
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था॥
translations.transliteration:
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī।
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the **Anāhata** (Heart Chakra) Lotus, piercer of the **Rudra knot**. Resting within the **Ājñā Cakra** (Third Eye), residing in the **thousand-petalled lotus** (Sahasrāra).

translations.original:
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी।
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī।
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā॥

translations.english: Dwelling in the middle of the **ocean of nectar** (Sudhā-Sāgara), named **Desire** (Kāma), having the **form of Desire**. Named Kāma, beloved of Kāma, the **Goddess of Desire**, the **giver of Desire**.

translations.original:
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा।
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः॥
translations.transliteration:
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā।
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ॥

translations.english: **Enjoyer** (Bhoginī), the **form of enjoyment**, the **Goddess of enjoyment**, the **giver of enjoyment**. **Transcending virtue and vice**, **transcending everything**, having an **auspicious form**.

translations.original:
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला।
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā।
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā॥

translations.english: **Beautiful** (Sundarī), **three-eyed** (Tryambakā), **Complete** (Pūrṇā), the form of **Brahman**, **Unequalled**. The **form of knowledge**, **Desirable**, the prime Deity of **Mahālakṣmī**.

translations.original:
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The **Supreme Self** (Paramātmikā), **transcending Māyā**, **transcending knowledge**, the **immutable radiance**. **Transcending everything**, **worshipped by all**, the form of the **union of Śiva and Śakti**.

translations.original:
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका।
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā।
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī॥

translations.english: **Lalitā**, the form of **Viṣṇu**, the form of **Brahmā**, the essence of **Śiva**. The **wife of Sadāśiva**, the **form of the Supreme Brahman**.

translations.original:
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा।
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā।
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: The **form of Māyā**, **Mahā Kālī**, the **Yoginī**, the **form of Śakti**. Beloved of **Śaṅkara**, the form of the **Goddess**, the **form of prosperity**, fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी।
चतुर्-भुजा त्र्यम्बका च महा-लक्ष्मीः सदा-शिव-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī।
catur-bhujā tryambakā ca mahā-lakṣmīḥ sadā-śiva-priyā॥

translations.english: **Consisting of all knowledge**, **Tārā**, **Bhuvaneśvarī**, the **three beautiful ones**. **Four-armed**, **three-eyed**, **Mahālakṣmī**, **beloved of Sadāśiva**.

translations.original:
कन्दर्प-सुन्दरी बाला रुक्मिणी रुक्म-मालिनी।
सुन्दरी-रूपिणी कामाख्या ललिताम्बिका॥
translations.transliteration:
kandarpa-sundarī bālā rukmiṇī rukma-mālinī।
sundarī-rūpiṇī kāmākhyā lalitāmbikā॥

translations.english: Beautiful as the **God of Love**, the **young girl**, **Rukmiṇī**, adorned with a **golden garland**. Having a **beautiful form**, named **Kāmākhyā**, the **Mother Lalitā**.

translations.original:
चन्द्रावती काम-रूपा कामाक्षी करुणा-मयी।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-काली महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा॥
translations.transliteration:
candrāvatī kāma-rūpā kāmākṣī karuṇā-mayī।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-kālī mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā॥

translations.english: Possessing the **Moon**, the **form of Desire**, the one with **desirable eyes**, full of **compassion**. **Mahālakṣmī**, **Mahākālī**, possessing **great existence**, the **Great Śiva** (Feminine).

translations.original:
चक्र-रूपा चक्र-रूपा च त्रि-पुर-भैरवी।
शिव-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपिणी च चतुर्-रूपिणी च सु-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
cakra-rūpā cakra-rūpā ca tri-pura-bhairavī।
śiva-śaktiḥ tri-rūpiṇī ca catur-rūpiṇī ca su-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The **form of the Cakra**, the **form of the Cakra**, and the **Bhairavī of the Three Cities**. The **power of Śiva**, having **three forms**, having **four forms**, and having an **excellent form**.

translations.original:
सद्-आत्मा सङ्गिनी च साध्वी च सु-संस्थिता।
सरस्-वती ज्ञान-रूपा शान्ति-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
sad-ātmā saṅginī ca sādhvī ca su-saṁsthitā।
saras-vatī jñāna-rūpā śānti-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: The **eternal Self**, the **associate**, the **virtuous one**, **well-established**. **Sarasvatī**, the form of **Knowledge**, the form of **Peace**, Her **own true form**.

translations.original:
निर्-विकारा निराबाधा निर्-लेपा निर्-मला।
ब्रह्म-रूपा विष्णु-रूपा शिव-रूपा पर-ईश्वरी॥
translations.transliteration:
nir-vikārā nirābādhā nir-lepā nir-malā।
brahma-rūpā viṣṇu-rūpā śiva-rūpā para-īśvarī॥

translations.english: **Without modification**, **unhindered**, **unattached**, **pure**. The form of **Brahmā**, the form of **Viṣṇu**, the form of **Śiva**, the **Supreme Goddess**.

translations.original:
शक्ति-रूपा मातृ-रूपा विश्व-रूपा अ-तुला।
आनन्द-मयी नित्या शुद्ध-विद्या वि-लासनी॥
translations.transliteration:
śakti-rūpā mātṛ-rūpā viśva-rūpā a-tulā।
ānanda-mayī nityā śuddha-vidyā vi-lāsinī॥

translations.english: The form of **Power**, the form of the **Mother**, the **universal form**, **unequalled**. Full of **Bliss**, **Eternal**, **Pure Knowledge**, the **playful one**.

translations.original:
भुवनेश्वरी गायत्री भुवनेशी चतुर्-भुजा।
त्रि-शक्तिः त्रि-रूपा त्रि-पदा त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
bhuvaneśvarī gāyatrī bhuvaneśī catur-bhujā।
tri-śaktiḥ tri-rūpā tri-padā tripura-sundarī॥

translations.english: The **Ruler of the Worlds**, **Gāyatrī**, the Mistress of the Worlds, **four-armed**. The **three powers**, **three forms**, **three-footed**, the **Beauty of the Three Cities**.

translations.original:
चतुर्-वक्त्र-समान-आकारा चतुर्-बाहु-समन्विता।
महा-लक्ष्मीः महा-देवी महा-काली महा-गौरी॥
translations.transliteration:
catur-vaktra-samāna-ākārā catur-bāhu-samanvitā।
mahā-lakṣmīḥ mahā-devī mahā-kālī mahā-gaurī॥

translations.english: Having a form like the **four-faced Brahmā**, possessing **four arms**. **Mahālakṣmī**, the **Great Goddess**, **Mahākālī**, the **Great Gaurī**.

translations.original:
महा-शक्तिः महा-रूपा महा-सत्त्वा महा-शिवा।
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या सर्व-विद्या-आदि-देवता॥
translations.transliteration:
mahā-śaktiḥ mahā-rūpā mahā-sattvā mahā-śivā।
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā sarva-vidyā-ādi-devatā॥

translations.english: The **Great Power**, the **Great Form**, the **Great Existence**, the **Great Śiva** (Feminine). **Transcending everything**, **worshipped by all**, the **prime Deity of all knowledge**.

translations.original:
सर्व-विद्या-मयी मोक्ष-दात्री त्रिपुर-सुन्दरी।
ईश्वर-ईश्वरी देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-vidyā-mayī mokṣa-dātrī tripura-sundarī।
īśvara-īśvarī devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā॥

translations.english: **Consisting of all knowledge**, the giver of **Liberation**, the **Beauty of the Three Cities**. The **Goddess of the Lord**, the form of the **Goddess**, the **form of prosperity**, fond of prosperity.

translations.original:
मन्त्र-रूपा तन्त्र-रूपा यन्त्र-रूपा स्व-रूपिणी।
अखण्ड-तत्व-रूपा च निगमागम-संस्थिता॥
translations.transliteration:
mantra-rūpā tantra-rūpā yantra-rūpā sva-rūpiṇī।
akhaṇḍa-tatva-rūpā ca nigamāgama-saṁsthitā॥

translations.english: The form of **Mantra**, the form of **Tantra**, the form of **Yantra**, Her **own true form**. The form of the **indivisible reality**, established in the **Vedas and Āgamas**.

translations.original:
चतुःषष्टि-उपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टि-कला-मयी।
चतुःषष्टि-महा-योगीनी-गण-सेविता॥
translations.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭi-upacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭi-kalā-mayī।
catuḥṣaṣṭi-mahā-yoginī-gaṇa-sevitā॥

translations.english: Rich in **sixty-four services**, consisting of **sixty-four arts**. Served by the host of **sixty-four great Yoginīs**.

translations.original:
मनु-विद्या चन्द्र-विद्या चक्रिणी चक्र-रूपिणी।
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्म-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
manu-vidyā candra-vidyā cakriṇī cakra-rūpiṇī।
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahma-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: The **Manu Vidyā**, the **Candra Vidyā**, the **possessor of the Cakra**, having the **form of the Cakra**. Residing solely in the **Mūlādhāra**, piercer of the **Brahma knot**.

translations.original:
मणि-पूरान्तर-उदिता विष्णु-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी।
अनाहताब्ज-निलया रुद्र-ग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी॥
translations.transliteration:
maṇi-pūrāntara-uditā viṣṇu-granthi-vibhedinī।
anāhatābja-nilayā rudra-granthi-vibhedinī॥

translations.english: Rising within the **Maṇipūra** Cakra, piercer of the **Viṣṇu knot**. Dwelling in the **Anāhata** Lotus, piercer of the **Rudra knot**.

translations.original:
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तर-आलीना सहस्र-दल-पद्म-स्था।
सुधा-सागर-मध्य-स्था काम-आख्या काम-रूपिणी॥
translations.transliteration:
ājñā-cakrāntara-ālīnā sahasra-dala-padma-sthā।
sudhā-sāgara-madhya-sthā kāma-ākhyā kāma-rūpiṇī॥

translations.english: Resting within the **Ājñā Cakra**, residing in the **thousand-petalled lotus** (Sahasrāra). Dwelling in the middle of the **ocean of nectar**, named **Desire**, having the **form of Desire**.

translations.original:
कामाख्या काम-प्रिया च काम-ईश्वरी काम-दा।
भोगिनी भोग-रूपा च भोग-ईश्वरी भोग-दा॥
translations.transliteration:
kāmākhyā kāma-priyā ca kāma-īśvarī kāma-dā।
bhoginī bhoga-rūpā ca bhoga-īśvarī bhoga-dā॥

translations.english: Named **Kāma**, **beloved of Kāma**, the **Goddess of Desire**, the **giver of Desire**. **Enjoyer**, the **form of enjoyment**, the **Goddess of enjoyment**, the **giver of enjoyment**.

translations.original:
पुण्या-अपुण्या-अतीता च सर्वातीता शुभा-आकृतिः।
सुन्दरी त्र्यम्बका पूर्णा ब्रह्म-रूपा अ-तुला॥
translations.transliteration:
puṇyā-apuṇyā-atītā ca sarvātītā śubhā-ākṛtiḥ।
sundarī tryambakā pūrṇā brahma-rūpā a-tulā॥

translations.english: **Transcending virtue and vice**, **transcending everything**, having an **auspicious form**. **Beautiful**, **three-eyed**, **Complete**, the form of **Brahman**, **Unequalled**.

translations.original:
विद्या-रूपिणी कामिनी च महा-लक्ष्म्य-अधि-देवता।
परमात्मिका माया-तीता विद्या-तीता विभा-अच्युता॥
translations.transliteration:
vidyā-rūpiṇī kāminī ca mahā-lakṣmya-adhi-devatā।
paramātmikā māyā-atītā vidyā-atītā vibhā-acyutā॥

translations.english: The **form of knowledge**, **Desirable**, the prime Deity of **Mahālakṣmī**. The **Supreme Self**, **transcending Māyā**, **transcending knowledge**, the **immutable radiance**.

translations.original:
सर्व-अतीता सर्व-आराध्या शिव-शक्ती-ऐक्य-रूपिणी।
ललिता विष्णु-रूपा च ब्रह्म-रूपा शिवात्मिका॥
translations.transliteration:
sarva-atītā sarva-ārādhyā śiva-śaktī-aikya-rūpiṇī।
lalitā viṣṇu-rūpā ca brahma-rūpā śivātmikā॥

translations.english: **Transcending everything**, **worshipped by all**, the form of the **union of Śiva and Śakti**. **Lalitā**, the form of **Viṣṇu**, the form of **Brahmā**, the essence of **Śiva**.

translations.original:
सदा-शिव-कुटुम्बिनी पर-ब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी।
माया-रूपा महा-काली योगिनी शक्ति-रूपा॥
translations.transliteration:
sadā-śiva-kuṭumbinī para-brahma-svarūpiṇī।
māyā-rūpā mahā-kālī yoginī śakti-rūpā॥

translations.english: The **wife of Sadāśiva**, the **form of the Supreme Brahman**. The **form of Māyā**, **Mahā Kālī**, the **Yoginī**, the **form of Śakti**.

translations.original:
शङ्कर-प्रिया देवि-रूपा भग-रूपा भग-प्रिया।
सर्व-विद्या-मयी तारा भुवनेश्वरी त्रि-सुन्दरी॥
translations.transliteration:
śaṅkara-priyā devi-rūpā bhaga-rūpā bhaga-priyā।
sarva-vidyā-mayī tārā bhuvaneśvarī tri-sundarī॥

translations.english: Beloved of **Śaṅkara**, the form of the **Goddess**, the form of **prosperity**, fond of prosperity. **Consisting of all knowledge**, **Tārā**, **Bhuvaneśvarī**, the **three beautiful ones**.
